task_summary: The robot identifies, approaches, and grasps a die from the shelf to complete the pick action as seen over 9 frames.

task_long_description.overview: This episode demonstrates a robot arm executing the instruction 'pick the die.' The scene involves a shelf with cubby holes, a small die placed inside one compartment, and a blue articulated robotic arm approaching and grasping it. The behavior is constrained by accurate visual perception of the die and careful maneuvering for a successful grasp. The robot's gripper opens, aligns above the die, lowers carefully until contact, then closes with moderate force. Completion is verified by stable grasp detection.
preconditions: Die is present and visible on the shelf
Gripper is functional and start position is safe
stepwise_plan: Check die visibility; scan if not found
success_criteria: Gripper is closed with the die securely inside
failure_and_recovery: Die not visible: rescan with fallback
Unstable grasp: retry closing or re-align
Contact not detected: repeat lowering motion
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when die is confirmed in gripper with stable grasp.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if die is presently visible.
Scans workspace for die in grid pattern.
Detects die and refines pose estimate.
Opens gripper to appropriate width for die.
Moves gripper to pose safely above die for pre-grasp.
Aligns gripper with die within tight tolerance.
Lowers gripper until contact with die detected.
Closes gripper at moderate force to grasp die.
Verifies that the grasp is stable.
Checks that die is firmly held.

failure_modes: Die not found by perception system
Gripper fails to open or close
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for die up to 3 times if not visible
Abort and log if object verification fails
assumptions: The instruction 'pick the die' refers precisely to the small object in the bottom-right shelf compartment as seen at all frames
Frames do not show die movement after grasp nor transfer motion; BT terminates at the confirmed grasp phase
No explicit retry attempts specified in instruction, but fallback for scan included due to likely occlusion
No placement or transfer required: only grasp

expected_success_criteria: Die is detected, grasped, and confirmed securely in gripper
